summary: I totally ship Arya with Gendry. He’s so clearly jealous when she talks to other boys and pissed because he knows she’s a lady...
body:
I totally ship Arya with Gendry. He’s so clearly jealous when she talks to other boys and pissed because he knows she’s a lady and they have no hope of ever being together. 

Also, I laughed so much when they were in the brothel and Arya was like “just because this girl has black hair it doesn’t mean she’s Robert’s daughter, Gendry has black hair too”

YOU KNOW NOTHING, ARYA STARK

reblog.comment:

summary: Game of Thrones Wraps Its Final Season The HBO hit series Game of Thrones is complete. The cast celebrated with a wrap party...
caption:
Game of Thrones Wraps Its Final Season

The HBO hit series Game of Thrones is complete. The cast celebrated with a wrap party last Sunday, but production did not officially end until July 6, when they shot the final scenes.

summary: The Eligible Bachelors and Bachelorettes of Westeros!
title: The Eligible Bachelors and Bachelorettes of Westeros!
body:
The Eligible Bachelors and Bachelorettes of Westeros!

So, having re-watched all of Game of Thrones over the past months, I’ve now finished it again (for the fourth time? wow I’m such a dork). And thought it would be fun to do a rundown of Game of Thrones most eligible Bachelors and Bachelorettes!

But before we get to our single and unmarried contestants, let’s look at the two couples that have declared their love and more or less seem to be a done…

View On WordPress

tags: im gonna do this for the other houses this was fun
body:
Starks&co + texts I’ve received

Ned: people who live here think they’re special because they have “northern grit” and can wear shorts in the middle of January, like no, tommy, that doesn’t make you special, it makes you stupid

Catelyn: listen, listen, he is my son, but also, if he keeps acting like this, I’m gonna kick him in the mouth

Robb: my diagnosis is that you are falling in love with my dog, and you wouldn’t be the first

Jon: Nevermind, I’m back on board with the plan and ready to fuck a corpse if I have to

Sansa: Just because you’re tall and you have red hair doesn’t mean you get to do whatever the fuck you want

Arya: open up to him, y’know!!! but don’t tell him about your dead family right off the bat, maybe start with your alcoholism

Bran: what’s it like???? not having to feel any emotions??? im jealous

Rickon: ur curls are too precious, too pure, for this world, don’t let those frat boys touch ur hair

Theon: I wanna respond to you coming for me in the comments but then that’s just admitting I’m a bottom on your instagram page

Brienne: you can’t die an honorable death if your last meal is pizza rolls!!!!!!

Jojen: is that guy dressed like where’s waldo or is the xanax just stronger than usual today??

Meera: lumberjack lesbians are a thing & i am one of them!!!!

Arya felt more a lamb, surrounded by a herd of other sheep. She hated the villagers for their sheepishness, almost as much as she hated herself.

summary: Wolf puppies, reblog with a book!arya headcanon. 1) Arya loves to cook. It’s her secret special talent and she is really really...
body:
Wolf puppies, reblog with a book!arya headcanon.

1) Arya loves to cook. It’s her secret special talent and she is really really good at it; she makes Umma cry tears of joy. It also helps her calm down when she has really bad nightmares.

+

Sansa is really happy about this cause it means endless supply of lemon cakes. She and Rickon fight over who gets to lick the spoon.

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

summary: "They hung upon the walls, before her and behind her, high and low, everywhere she looked, everywhere she turned. She saw old...
body:
“They hung upon the walls, before her and behind her, high and low, everywhere she looked, everywhere she turned. She saw old faces and young faces, pale faces and dark faces, smooth faces and wrinkled faces, freckled faces and scarred faces, handsome faces and homely faces, men and women, boys and girls, even babes, smiling faces, frowning faces, faces full of greed and rage and lust, bald faces and faces bristling with hair. Masks, she told herself, it’ s only masks, but even as she thought the thought, she knew it wasn’t so. They were skins.”

In the last few lines of the above excerpt where Arya tries to tell herself that the faces are only masks, even when she knows that they are skins shows how shaken up she really is. She is not someone who is obsessed with death or revenge as the media potrays her to be. Rather Arya is a little girl who thinks that she has nothing left in this world and is therefore always afraid of being kicked out to fend for herself. In fact we see this in the next paragraph when the Kindly Man asks Arya whether the faces frighten her and reassures her that she can still leave the HoBaW if she wants. Arya’s immediate reaction to this is to ask herself whether she has anywhere else to go if she leaves this place. Now what’s even more interesting than this is that when the Kindly Man asks her if she truly wants this ( i.e. to be an assassin), Arya is shown to be indecisive. The fact that she doesn’t even consider her list or her revenge in all these must amount to something. In fact I think that she forces herself to be brave and to wear a face for her first assignment bc she fears that failing to do so would lead the faceless men to throw her out of the HoBaW.

So in conclusion I would only like to say that Arya is not someone who is guided by her thoughts of revenge but rather she is someone who is a victim of her situation.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

body:
Gendrya Fanfic

Something that really bothers me with the gendrya fandom is the fan fiction. Now, I have never been a big fan of fanfics anyway. I’ve read some when I was like 14-16 and one day I just stopped because I couldn’t deal with the falseness of it anymore. There were some that were quite good but 99% of the ones that I’ve read (and I’m not just talking about gendrya fic here, these are the ones I’ve read when I was younger and in different fandoms) were just bad. It’s usually not the plot that makes a fanfic bad. It’s the characters. Because the characters that we know, that we love suddenly turn into complete clichés and stereotypes. They are such twisted forms of their originals that they feel like new found characters purely drawn out of the fan fic writes’s mind that have nothing to do with the real characters. That often happens because (1) we don’t analyse the characters thoroughly (2) we simply don’t understand some of their aspects that no matter how unimportant they seem have a huge impact on our perception of them as individuals or (3) we don’t like some of their character traits so we leave them out thus matching them with our wishes and changing them. And the thing that frustrates me is not the delusions of the writers but the fact that they transfer them to the readers and by doing that they change their perception of the characters as well and give them their own false, subjective image of the characters. And that’s almost always the case. I recently started a Gendrya fic where Arya and Gendry were just so ooc that I immediately stopped reading it. It doesn’t surprise me at all that Arya is viewed as the tomboy-that-hates-all-girls-and-wishes-she-had-a-d***, as an irrational rage monster and as a psychotic loner that wears black and hates everyone. It doesn’t surprise me that Gendry is seen as the nice-guy-that-doesn’t-have-a-backbone when in most fanfics he has fallen into the “plain handsome guy that would do anything for the girl”- trope. And really anyone who has read the books at least once knows that that’s simply not true. You don’t need to have an English major or be a literature student to see that. The text does not support this. It’s nowhere implied. It’s just complete trash and untrue. The reason why this happens is because we tend to think in boxes. A boy that writes poetry and has female friends? He’s gay! A girl that doesn’t wear make-up and dresses in plain clothes? She’s special and better than other girls! Arya is a tomboy? Well ofc she doesn’t want kids and only hangs out with guys and thinks that feelings are stupid and make you weak! And because she is a “strong” woman (god I hate that term) she is either not going to have a lover OR her lover will be weak and submissive so that her strength is more emphasised. Which is why Gendry is (often) portrayed as less stubborn and defiant and mellowed down, despite his (canon!!) strong, stubborn and forceful personality. And what’s the point in that? By changing the characters you also change their dynamic that we were so invested in and which was the reason why we started reading fanfics in the first place. So what’s the point in reading them? It really makes me angry. Because I love the characters and I hate that people twist them around in their heads and give them traits that we have no reason in believing they possess. I just really wanted to get this out and let me know if you feel the same way. I don’t think it’s just gendrya fanfic, I’ve read enough other fanfics that had the same problems. Maybe it’s also the age that’s the problem since a lot of fics are written by younger fans that are not mature enough to understand the complexity and depth of these characters but I hope it will change.

There were some that were quite good but 99% of the ones that I’ve read (and I’m not just talking about gendrya fic here, these are the ones I’ve read when I was younger and in different fandoms) were just bad. It’s usually not the plot that makes a fanfic bad. It’s the characters. Because the characters that we know, that we love suddenly turn into complete clichés and stereotypes. They are such twisted forms of their originals that they feel like new found characters purely drawn out of the fan fic writes’s mind that have nothing to do with the real characters. That often happens because (1) we don’t analyse the characters thoroughly (2) we simply don’t understand some of their aspects that no matter how unimportant they seem have a huge impact on our perception of them as individuals or (3) we don’t like some of their character traits so we leave them out thus matching them with our wishes and changing them. And the thing that frustrates me is not the delusions of the writers but the fact that they transfer them to the readers and by doing that they change their perception of the characters as well and give them their own false, subjective image of the characters. And that’s almost always the case. I recently started a Gendrya fic where Arya and Gendry were just so ooc that I immediately stopped reading it. It doesn’t surprise me at all that Arya is viewed as the tomboy-that-hates-all-girls-and-wishes-she-had-a-d***, as an irrational rage monster and as a psychotic loner that wears black and hates everyone. It doesn’t surprise me that Gendry is seen as the nice-guy-that-doesn’t-have-a-backbone when in most fanfics he has fallen into the “plain handsome guy that would do anything for the girl”- trope. And really anyone who has read the books at least once knows that that’s simply not true. You don’t need to have an English major or be a literature student to see that. The text does not support this. It’s nowhere implied. It’s just complete trash and untrue. The reason why this happens is because we tend to think in boxes. A boy that writes poetry and has female friends? He’s gay! A girl that doesn’t wear make-up and dresses in plain clothes? She’s special and better than other girls! Arya is a tomboy? Well ofc she doesn’t want kids and only hangs out with guys and thinks that feelings are stupid and make you weak! And because she is a “strong” woman (god I hate that term) she is either not going to have a lover OR her lover will be weak and submissive so that her strength is more emphasised. Which is why Gendry is (often) portrayed as less stubborn and defiant and mellowed down, despite his (canon!!) strong, stubborn and forceful personality. And what’s the point in that? By changing the characters you also change their dynamic that we were so invested in and which was the reason why we started reading fanfics in the first place. So what’s the point in reading them? It really makes me angry. Because I love the characters and I hate that people twist them around in their heads and give them traits that we have no reason in believing they possess. I just really wanted to get this out and let me know if you feel the same way. I don’t think it’s just gendrya fanfic, I’ve read enough other fanfics that had the same problems. Maybe it’s also the age that’s the problem since a lot of fics are written by younger fans that are not mature enough to understand the complexity and depth of these characters but I hope it will change.

blog.name: nobodysuspectsthebutterfly
blog.title: Nobody ever suspects the butterfly...
blog.description:
Hey, you can call me Mindset, or Butterfly.
I like: Comics, ASOIAF, music, art, books, sf & fantasy, butterflies, birds, pretty rocks, and many other things. See my sidebar tags and links for more details.
I help mod: ASOIAF University and A Song of Theories.
Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

tags: this is a super-interesting question - thanks anon!
summary: Do you think Arya's problems with needlework might come from her being left handed? Especially if she was being taught to do it...
question: Do you think Arya's problems with needlework might come from her being left handed? Especially if she was being taught to do it with her right hand?
answer:
Hmm, from what we see, Syrio is the first to recognize Arya’s left-handedness:

It was not just a stick, but a true wooden sword complete with grip and guard and pommel. Arya picked it up and clutched it nervously with both hands, holding it out in front of her. It was heavier than it looked, much heavier than Needle.
The bald man clicked his teeth together. “That is not the way, boy. This is not a greatsword that is needing two hands to swing it. You will take the blade in one hand.”
“It’s too heavy,” Arya said.
“It is heavy as it needs to be to make you strong, and for the balancing. A hollow inside is filled with lead, just so. One hand now is all that is needing.”
Arya took her right hand off the grip and wiped her sweaty palm on her pants. She held the sword in her left hand. He seemed to approve.
“The left is good. All is reversed, it will make your enemies more awkward.”

–AGOT, Arya II

…and not just the first to recognize it, but approve of it…

Then yes, I think it’s very probable that Arya had trouble coordinating her stitches due to being taught to use the wrong hand. And not just needlework, but likely other crafts (drawing, painting), and musical instruments too.*

Mind you, I don’t think Arya has realized that her sword hand (and stick hand) is the one she should be using for other coordinated work, as per her TWOW preview chapter Mercy’s sewing is still “wretched”. Maybe that will change eventually?

*(Note: I’m a lefty, and though I never had trouble with my teachers due to observant and caring parents (my dad’s a lefty too), I think my left-handedness was a possible reason why I never had much in the way of music lessons. Also note that my younger brother did have a teacher who claimed he couldn’t write, until my parents found out the reason, that she was trying to force him right, and well that teacher got her ass handed to her, and the situation fixed immediately.)

summary: She is beauty, she is grace, she punched Joffrey in the face.
text: She is beauty, she is grace, she punched Joffrey in the face.
